content.text: I am XploreKodo, your agency design and system architecture assistant. How can I assist you today?

items.content: Design the Pydantic data model blueprint for the 'AgentConfigSchema'. It needs fields for `agent_name` (str), `model_id` (str), and `instructions_path` (str or Path) to support the God Agent's ability to configure any agent in the SACM.

Design a Pydantic model called 'AgentConfigSchema' with the following fields: 
- agent_name: str
- model_id: str
- instructions_path: Union[str, Path]
This model will be used by the God Agent to configure any agent in the SACM system. 'instructions_path' must support both a string and a pathlib.Path type. Include type annotations and a simple docstring.

items.name: send_message

content.text:
Here is the Pydantic data model blueprint for the AgentConfigSchema:

```python
from pydantic import BaseModel
from typing import Union
from pathlib import Path

class AgentConfigSchema(BaseModel):
    """
    Configuration schema for SACM agents, specifying the agent's name, associated model,
    and location of the instructions file. The instructions_path can be a string or a pathlib.Path.
    """
    agent_name: str  # The unique name assigned to the agent.
    model_id: str  # The identifier for the model to be used by this agent.
    instructions_path: Union[str, Path]  # Path to the instructions file, as a string or pathlib.Path object.
```

This model supports configuration of any agent by the God Agent in the SACM and ensures instructions_path can be either a string or a Path. Let me know if you need further extension or serialization/validation logic!
